declarations.name: getArgumentInjectionPattern
declarations.description: Returns the current [argument injection pattern](#Argument injection pattern).

overloads.syntax: static view<char8> Logger::getArgumentInjectionPattern()

declarations.name: setArgumentInjectionPattern
declarations.description: Replaces the current [argument injection pattern](#Argument injection pattern) with `pattern`. This operation affects all active and future Logger instances.

overloads.syntax: static void Logger::setArgumentInjectionPattern(view<char8> pattern)

declarations.name: format
declarations.description: Returns a string containing the formatted argument(s).

overloads.syntax:
template<typename Argument>
static sequence<char8> Logger::format(Argument&& argument)

template<typename Argument, typename... PackedArgument>
static sequence<char8> Logger::format(view<char8> pattern, Argument&& argument, PackedArgument&&... packedArguments)
overloads.description: Uses the [argument injection patterns](#Argument injection pattern) found in `pattern` to inject each formatted argument at the right position. If there are more arguments than injection patterns, the remaining arguments are silently discarded.

declarations.name: timestamp
declarations.description: Returns a formatted string representing the current timestamp, with precision to the millisecond. The timestamp follows the format `%H:%M:%S.{%MS:0<3}`.

overloads.syntax: static sequence<char8> Logger::timestamp()
explicit ConsoleLogger::ConsoleLogger(std::ostream& stream, LogLevel logLevel, view<char8> source)

declarations.name: trace
declarations.description: Writes a trace log to the console output stream. `file` and `line` appear in a stack trace inserted after the log message.

overloads.syntax:
template<typename Argument>
void ConsoleLogger::trace(view<char8> file, uint32 line, Argument&& argument)

template<typename Argument, typename... PackedArgument>
void ConsoleLogger::trace(view<char8> file, uint32 line, view<char8> pattern, Argument&& argument, PackedArgument&&... packedArguments)

declarations.description: Writes a debug log to the console output stream.

overloads.syntax:
template<typename Argument>
void ConsoleLogger::debug(Argument&& argument)

template<typename Argument, typename... PackedArgument>
void ConsoleLogger::debug(view<char8> pattern, Argument&& argument, PackedArgument&&... packedArguments)

overloads.syntax:
